messages.subject: Re: Buffalo horn
messages.msgSnippet: ... limited) ... 2265107133&rd=1 ... I have a simple oval horn tsuba that I m sure is of Japanese origin on a Shinshinto tanto, so I guess horn tsuba existed.
messages.messageBody:
--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, <apedraza@v...> wrote:
>
> Curious as to what you all think of this. To the best of my (
limited)
> knowledge, no such tsuba existed. Fake, right?
>
> http://cgi.ebay.com/ws/eBayISAPI.dll?ViewItem&category=4080&item=
2265107133&rd=1
>

I have a simple oval horn tsuba that I'm sure is
of Japanese origin on a Shinshinto tanto, so
I guess horn tsuba existed. I would think only
for small decorative blades. Horn certainly wouldn't
be "battle worthy" on a katana size blade.

Rich S
